urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

urls.title: Whinlatter Forest project aims to slow floodwater
urls.description: Work has started on a project at Whinlatter Forest to help slow the flow of water towards Lorton and the River Cocker. West Cumbria Rivers Trust is working with Forestry England and the Environment Agency to install over 200 leaky dams in Aiken Beck, Whinlatter Gill and tributaries and forest...

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @HugoSAS @EnvAgency Thank you for highlighting this. Incidents should be published. However, unfortunately the EA is both regulator & prosecutor for environmental pollution? As such, prosecution (publication) could suggest policy failure. Perhaps it's time to devolve departmental responsibility.

Tankering sewage around is cheaper than sorting out the causes and the failed sewage system @thameswater  The @EnvAgency and @ofwat condone it so the customer and environment take the hit @sandralaville @GeorgeMonbiot @robertcourts  This was a delivery TO Eynsham Oxon today. https://t.co/VTX0ALbYf1

Day Nine.
The pollution is STILL emanating from Furness Vale Marina, stretching over a mile to New Mills. The boom at Bridge 29 isn't working and the polluting waste oil is just as bad as it was a week ago. Why is the slick still not being stopped at Bridge 30? @CanalRiverTrust https://t.co/9lxlWtbhQe
